issues.description: The problem statement (and the template's commented Main) define Milkable.messageOnMilk() as a no-argument method returning a String (and the instructions specify the return text should be "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"). However, the solution repository defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (i.e., it requires a double parameter) and the implementations in Seal and Goat use that parameter and include a volume in the returned string. This parameter mismatch means the solution's interface and implementations do not match the method signature students expect from the problem description and template (and the template's Main calls messageOnMilk() with no arguments). This will confuse students and can cause compilation or integration problems if they try to combine the provided template/main code with the solution classes.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Milkable API with the problem statement and template by removing the volume parameter. Change Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) to messageOnMilk():String and update Seal and Goat to implement messageOnMilk() with no parameters, returning the specified text (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked"). Also ensure any calls (e.g., in Main) invoke messageOnMilk() with no arguments. Alternatively, if the volume parameter is intentional, update the problem statement, template Main, and examples to document and call messageOnMilk(double) consistently and adjust the expected return text to include the volume.

issues.description: Mismatch in the Milkable API and expected behavior: the problem statement / UML and the template's example usage expect a no-argument method messageOnMilk() returning a String in the format "[Animal Type] [name] is milked". The solution repository instead defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (takes a double parameter) and the Seal/Goat implementations return strings that include the provided volume (e.g. "Seal Clarabelle is milked (2.0L)"). This difference in method signature and expected return value creates a conceptual and API mapping mismatch for students (they will implement/expect a no-arg method but find a solution using a parametric version), increasing extraneous cognitive load and risking compilation/usage confusion.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the Milkable API consistent across artifacts. Either:

1) Align the solution with the problem/template: change the interface to String messageOnMilk() (no parameters) and update Seal/Goat implementations to return exactly "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (e.g. "Seal Clarabelle is milked"). Update any example calls (Main) accordingly. This preserves the original exercise contract and expected output format.

OR

2) If volume is intended as part of the exercise, update the problem statement and template to declare messageOnMilk(double volume) and change the specified return format to include the volume (and update examples in Main and tests). Choose one of these two options so students see a single, consistent API and expected output.
